<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 14"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Sunder Enchantment](/Feats.aspx?ID=5865) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Barbarian" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=813" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 83 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Prerequisites**
[Sunder Spell](/Feats.aspx?ID=5859)

</column>

---

You can focus your superstition to break the magic of an item, in addition to destroying freestanding spells and those active on creatures. When you Sunder a Spell, you can instead attempt to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) either an unattended magic item or one of your target's magic items. If your counteract attempt succeeds, the item becomes a mundane item of its type for 10 minutes. If you target an [artifact](/Traits.aspx?ID=537), an [intelligent item](/Traits.aspx?ID=636), or a similarly particularly powerful item, your counteract attempt automatically fails.
name: Sunder Enchantment
